result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Received, Filed, and Forwarded to the Judge for review; Defense Motion to Admit Other Acts Evidence Under McMorris

Defendant Daniel Bell Cotton in court.  Attorney Eric m Hailstock Mr in court for Daniel Bell Cotton.  Attorney Mallory R Davis in court for State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: SD. 
Matter scheduled for McMorris Hearing.  Defense counsel did not efile the motion and requests adjourned motion hearing date.  For reasons stated on the record, Court modifies JusticePoint supervision to Level 4.  Case adjourned, Br. 41.
Motion hearing scheduled for November 11, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Daniel Bell Cotton appeared by video.  Attorney Eric m Hailstock Mr appeared by video for Daniel Bell Cotton.  Attorney Mallory R Davis appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: SD. 
Arraignment held.  Defense counsel waived reading of the Complaint and entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of defendant.  Defense counsel requests McMorris Motion and final pretrial and jury trial dates.  Case adjourned, Br. 41.
Motion hearing scheduled for October 14, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Daniel Bell Cotton in court with attorney Eric m Hailstock.  Mallory R Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for arraignment hearing. Court is in trial on another case and is unable to proceed on this matter. Case is in trial posture, defense counsel requests case be placed on the trial calendar. Any pretrial motions to be filed a week before the final pretrial date. Case adjourned to Branch 35.  Parties are advised that effective August 1, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge Audrey Skwierawski, Branch 41 in Room 501 of the Courthouse.  Arraignment scheduled for August 25, 2022 at 01:30 pm.  Final pre-trial scheduled for October 10, 2022 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for November 28, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Case set for an arraignment.  Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Kiefer.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Rosa, Br. 35.  Arraignment scheduled for July 20, 2022 at 08:30 am.

CASE HEARD IN PRELIM FOR BR. 29
Defendant Daniel Bell Cotton in court, appear by video with attorney Eric m Hailstock, appear by video.  Mallory R Davis appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: H. Wolber.   State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  State advise the court to remind the defendant to update with Justice Point. Court advise defendant. Case is adjourned to Branch 29.  Defense request an Arraignment date.  Arraignment scheduled for June 28, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Daniel Bell Cotton in court with attorney Eric m Hailstock.  Defendant Daniel Bell Cotton in custody.  Thomas Hasle appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Daniel Bell Cotton appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Havas, Branch 10.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT HAS RETAINED PRIVATE COUNSEL.
